name: Buneary
disruptions:
Board: 1st-4th column is Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: None

Notes: 15 Rocks in each Column will skyfall
           before your Pokemon
clearingStrategy:
Good stage for Low Level grinding.
Nothing much to say here
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left
If you cannot S-Rank it now, come back
here if you get Fighting Types. Also
Move+5 will do this if needed

name: Treecko
disruptions:
Board: In the center: 4 Treeckos in Barriers.
           2 Treecko at the top and bottom
Initial: None
Timer: Add 2 Barriers every 4 turns
recommendedParty:
[Any]

Charmander, Torchic,
Nidoran F or M
clearingStrategy:
This time, you are introduced to Barriers.
Use the Treeckos at the Top or Bottom
to clear the Treeckos in Barrier. Then 
proceed at combos while clearing
those Barrier at the top
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Come back later for stronger SE Pokemons
if you cannot do it now. Bringing Treecko
can clear out the board Treeckos but its not
very effective to be worth it.

name: Pikachu
disruptions:
Board: 4 Pichus in the center and 4 corners
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a Pikachu and a Pichu every 2
          turns
clearingStrategy:
Nothing you can do about the Pichus
except if you bring your own Pichu. 
Dont bother with them and just make
your combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 2 moves left
A Ground Type Team can finish this in 2-4 
turns which would be enough to S-Rank this.
But 5 turns with low health is rather very easy

name: Sableye
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a Sableye
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers every 4 turns.
          Adds a Sableye every 3 turns.
          Repeat.
clearingStrategy:
Dont bother with the Sableyes. Focus
on comboing and getting rid of barriers
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Heracross and Volbeat can finish this easily

name: Litwick
disruptions:
Board: Cross shaped Rocks (See Picture)
           3 Litwicks on its top
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
I dont recommend a Mega here since 
both of them are not very effective. 
Eliminate the Woods then match the
Litwick if you want (It is super
effective)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
Bringing Litwick can get this one

name: Chingling
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Barriers every 3 turns
clearingStrategy: Very easy stage. Can fall in 4-6 turns
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Heracross and Volbeat can finish this easily

name: Swirlix
disruptions:
Board: 1st, 2nd, 5th, 6th column in Barrier
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
Easy even with the barriers this is easy.
Audino and Kangaskhan will enjoy
their Mega effects here
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left
If you cannot S-Rank it now, wait for
Nidoran evolutions and Mega Mawile

name: Volbeat
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Very easy to S-Rank

name: Illumise
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Place 3 Illumise after 3 turns.
          Adds 3 Barriers in 3 turns.
          Repeat.
clearingStrategy: Much like Sableye. Just do combos
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left
Get stronger Pokemons if you cannot
S-Rank now

name: Mega Sableye
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Barriers
Timer: Adds 4 Barriers every 4 turns.

Half Health: Adds 4 Barriers every 3 turns.
clearingStrategy:
Can be hard depending on the barrier
disruption. But hey, you have Volbeat
now. Do match of 4 to trigger Crowd
Control which will deal huge damage
while making sure the top row isn't
in barrier
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Very easy to S-Rank itemless

For now skip S-Ranking it now. A team of
Mega Lucario or any decent Mega and
Move+5 will also do this
